docs.lead_paragraph: As President Obama prepares to address the nation, tell us whether you think America is headed in the right or wrong direction.

headline.main: Is America Headed in the Right Direction? Readers Respond

docs.lead_paragraph: A medical panel issued an update to its guidelines Monday, but still says women with average risk of breast cancer can safely begin screening at 50.

headline.main: Panel Reasserts Mammogram Advice That Triggered Breast Cancer Debate
headline.print_headline: Medical Panel Reasserts Advice, Limiting Mammograms, That Triggered a Debate

docs.abstract: Panel of medical experts reasserts 2009 advice that women can safely begin mammograms starting at age 50, rather than age 40 as previously suggested, and be tested every other year; advice, which sparked debate, applies to women with average risk of breast cancer.
docs.snippet: A medical panel issued an update to its guidelines Monday, but still says women with average risk of breast cancer can safely begin screening at 50.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Samsung Electronics reached a partial agreement on workplace safety with sickened workers and their families, nearly a decade after the death of a 22-year-old chip worker from leukemia galvanized concern about conditions in South Korea's semiconductor industry.

headline.main: Samsung Reaches Partial Agreement With Sick Workers
headline.print_headline: Samsung Reaches Partial Agreement With Sick Workers

docs.lead_paragraph: Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin has notified U.S. authorities that he plans to dismantle the state's health insurance exchange created under the Obama Administration's Affordable Care Act, the Courier-Journal reported on Monday.

headline.main: Kentucky Governor to Dismantle State's Health Insurance Exchange: Newspaper
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Governor to Dismantle State's Health Insurance Exchange: Newspaper

docs.snippet: Kentucky Governor Matt Bevin has notified U.S. authorities that he plans to dismantle the state's health insurance exchange created under the Obama Administration's Affordable Care Act, the Courier-Journal reported on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kentucky's new Republican administration is moving forward with plans to shut down the state's health insurance exchange, becoming the first state to cut ties with one of the key pieces of President Barack Obama's signature health care law because of a political promise.

headline.main: Kentucky Moves Ahead With Plans to Dismantle Health Exchange
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Moves Ahead With Plans to Dismantle Health Exchange

docs.lead_paragraph: About 15 state attorneys general have joined the Justice Department's probe of two big insurance mergers, according to people familiar with the matter, increasing the scrutiny on proposed deals that would reduce the number of nationwide health insurers to three from five.

headline.main: Exclusive: State Attorneys General Joining Probe of Health Insurer Mergers
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: State Attorneys General Joining Probe of Health Insurer Mergers

docs.lead_paragraph: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force declared Monday in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

headline.main: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50
headline.print_headline: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50

docs.snippet: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force declared Monday in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Confronts Bernie Sanders as Polls Show Her Lead in Iowa Narrowing
headline.print_headline: Clinton, Under Pressure in Iowa, Moves to Sharpen Differences With Sanders

docs.abstract: Facing new pressure from Bernie Sanders in Iowa, Hillary Clinton warn Iowans that, if elected president, he would put their health insurance in the hands of Republican governors and raise taxes on the middle class.
docs.snippet: Facing new pressure from Bernie Sanders in Iowa, Hillary Clinton warn Iowans that, if elected president, he would put their health insurance in the hands of Republican governors and raise taxes on the middle class.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Syrian scientist stricken with cancer and seeking a new start for his family in Michigan will represent Syrian refugees as a guest of first lady Michelle Obama for the president's final State of the Union address.

headline.main: Syrian Refugee Among First Lady's Guests for State of Union
headline.print_headline: Syrian Refugee Among First Lady's Guests for State of Union

docs.snippet: A Syrian scientist stricken with cancer and seeking a new start for his family in Michigan will represent Syrian refugees as a guest of first lady Michelle Obama for the president's final State of the Union address.
